responses: Sorry, can't understand you

Hi Sonia

Thanks for visiting Sonia,How can I help you?

I am Ericsson Bot

patterns: What can I do in this portal
responses: This portal is for submitting use cases and pain points related to data in the repository

patterns: Can people outside of Ericsson access this portal?
Can you tell me about who can access this portal
responses: Any Ericsson employee with valid credentials can get an access to the portal

patterns: Where will my submitted use cases go
Where will the submitted usecases go
To which place my usecases sent after submission
If I submit my usecase now where will it be sent
After submission of the usecase where will it go
responses: To the Data Enablement Office where the domain roll-out strategy is determined, and it helps domains to determine the critical data elements to be governed.

patterns: I have a few queries where should I go
My queries will be resolved by whom
responses: You can contact PDLCSSONDA@pdl.internal.ericsson.com for finding answers to specific queries

patterns: I have submitted my usecase is there someone who approves it
approval of the usecase is done by whom?
responses: Our highly skilled Data Strategy Driver assesses the data in terms of the use caseâ€™s feasibility,the impact it creates and finally approves the usecase provided by a stakeholder.

patterns: When will my usecase be approved
I have submitted my usecase when will it get approved
when will the submitted usecases be approved
responses: Your usecase will be approved as soon as it is verified by our coordinator team for the required mandatory fields.

patterns: If my usecase has been successfully created or approved,is it confirmed that my use case is selected
I have created my usecase will it be selected
My use case has been approved does that mean my usecase is selected
responses: Unfortunately No.Our team passes your usecase through various stages and your usecase will be shortlisted based on the impact it creates and its feasibility

patterns: I have submitted my pain point is there someone who approves it
approval of the pain point is done by whom?
responses: The Domain team/Enablers will choose the most relevant pain points

patterns: What does the stage in progress mean
The current status of my pain point is in progress what does that mean
My pain point is in progress what do you mean by that
responses: In progress means that the pain point has been selected and work has been going on to resolve it

patterns: what do you mean by waiting for implementation
waiting for implemenatation is the current status of my pain point what does that mean
responses: This means that the Domain team/Enablers are awaiting for a system/product to get implemented for resolving the required functionality pointed out in the pain point.

patterns: Done meaning in the status of pain point
what do you mean by done in the status
Done is the current status of my pain point what does that mean
responses: Done means that the pain point has been resolved and it satisfies the expectations of the stakeholder who proposed the pain point

patterns: what do you mean by a usecase
why should I provide a usecase
responses: A usecase addresses a business need with a specific purpose and a clear impact

patterns: Should I periodically update my usecase
Why should I update my usecase every now and then
How good it is to update the usecase that I provided
I have to make some changes in my usecase can I do that
responses: Updating a usecase will ensure its effectiveness,relevance and accuracy
Yes,absolutely you should update the usecase.This ensures that the usecase is effective,relevant and accurate
Yes,you should consider updating the usecase,this ensures that the usecase is up-to-date and is also relevant and feasible

patterns: Can I have a usecase without pain points
Is submitting a usecase without pain points feasible
responses: No you cannot have a usecase having no pain points
Sorry,you must have atleast 1 pain point for your usecase
You should atleast have 1 pain point for your usecase

patterns: What is the timeline for data use case assessment?
What is the timeline for data use case implementation?
responses: 3 weeks for E2E use case evaluation

patterns: Who funds the data use case implementation?
responses: MA/BA/GF funds the use case implementation. Data Domains are responsible for designing a solution. Implementation of the solution has to carried out by the usecase themselves
